text: Bottle from Hopfen & Malz - quite pale golden and only slightly cloudy for a keller. taste is dough, floral hops, spices, grainy, hay with a nicely balanced bitter finish. Good Keller.

Many thanks for this beer to kevnic2008. Piwo ma kapitalny wyglad. Piekna piana wytrwale stojaca przekraczajaca brzegi kufla. Kolor jasny mocno metny zoltawy o odcieniu zoltek jaj. Aromat lekko wedzarniczy, troche w zapachu jakby margaryna? w smaku bardzo przyjemne, rzeskie lekko kwaskowe bardzo niewiele slodowosci i cukru, kwasek i do tego chmielne choc niewiele to tworzy swietna pijalna calosc. Rzetelny piwniczniak

Bayerische Anstich at Akkurat. Almost clear deep golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of grain, bread, earth, floral hops, light mineral and yeast. Taste is very light sweet and light bitter with notes of the grain, bread, earth and floral hops. Bit malt husk astringency. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Really nice but a bit astringent.

Pours a vibrant, clouded golden color with a froth, medium sized white head.

Smells of hay, wet grass, white bread dough, young herbs and a strawy sweet whiff.

Has an effervescent, refreshing carbonation, among a light body, showcasing a mineralic quality during the finish.

Has a velvet beginning with subtle, bready malts, hay and a note of young garden herbs, developing a slightly mineralic, lively carbonation, which turns maltier, sweeter during mid palate with straw and an aqueous softness after the initial carbonation effervescence. Turns surprisingly dry during the finish with bready malts and a note of dry leaves, overcoming the malts easily.

This is a winner, subtle and versatile, very entertaining as for its prominent hop dryness, tied together by a world class balance.

500ml Bottle - Hazy golden with a white head. Lime, lemon, bread and some pleasant yeasty notes in the aroma. Refreshing taste with lemon, white baguette, lime and some grassy hops. Brilliantly refreshing.
Gravity Keg. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma of bread, grassy hops, flowers. Sweet cereals flavours, hoppy bitterness, fresh!

Bottle @ Bamberg comes to skovenhaven. Pours hazy Yellow with a white head. Aroma of ceral, herbal hops, light minerals, citrus, light honey notes. Taste is light sweet, with loads of citrus. Loads of fresh hops.

From bottle @ Bamberg comes to Skovhaven. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of bread, cereal, hoppy, floral, grassy and citrussy. Taste is fresh, hoppy, floral, light grassy, bready. Clean and refreshing!
50 cl bottle @ home. Orange color.Small head. Citrus, herbal, spicy.Creamy .Medium body.
Frankenfest 2016, Rome. Hazy, malty yellow. White cream. Rustic malty, orange malt, warm and crisp. Touch banana. Very fresh, warm german lager.
Gravity keg at Franken fest, Rome-Italy. Pours cloudy gold color, white foam. Nose: crumb, pastry, rustic. Mouth: crisp, grains, bitter finish.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy weak yeasty finish.

Bottle bought @ Landbierparadies. Pours hazy golden with a frothy and rocky white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some sparse thick trace in the glass. Smell is slightly malty, floral and herbal with sourdough crackers, crispbread, unsweetened rye bread, moist grass, lemon balm, dried yellow flowers, minerals and lemon peal. Taste is sweet, slightly bitter, malty and floral. Mouthfeel is soft, round, very tiny flat, very tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and slightly bitter with freshly baked rye bread, caramel, moist grass, hay, minerals and lemon peal. Yummy! Lip smacking bready malts, prominent floral and mineral forward hops, soft delicate mouthfeel. Delicious and very much quaffable!

Bottle (50 cl) from KeWe Getränktemarkt, Bamberg, Germany. Hazy golden, large white head. Bready, slightly earty aroma, some faint yeast notes, herbal hops. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness.

From the bottle, pours a light, hazy honey color with a big cream colored head. The smell is nutty, earthy malt, dull spice. The taste is as it smells with some holiness ink the end... Quite crisp, really. The body is light plus with soft carbonation. If love to try this one vom Faß!

500 ml bottle drank at Les Vignerons. (No proper tasting notes, overall impression only). Clear gold with a decent, lasting white head. Bred and nuts on the nose, togheter with a mineral and grassy presence. Smooth and super easy to drink, great balanced between bitter (herbal, grassy) components and slightly sweet/sour (camomile honey, lemon peel) components. Very nice overall, if not entirely fresh.

Tap at the brewery. Deep gold with a low, lacy head. Cloudy. Earthy, herbal hop nose, crusty bready. Lemony hop flavor, crisp, bready malts. Soft and mellow, but oily, with light carbonation. Touch of honey in there too. Served a bit too cold, actually! Get some oranges too as it opens up, Mandarina hops? Smooth honey-lemon flavors. Great.

Gravity pour at the Keller. Aroma is quite subtle with wet grain, hay, light grass. Taste is huge hoppiness, fresh grass, hay and yeast. Palate is a little more rich than standards and carbonation is low Very good but a little plain.

Gravity pour at the brewery garden. Aroma is grassy, very clean, deliciously hoppy, light subtle hay notes, hints of fresh bread, light soapy notes, a hint of vanilla as well. Taste is sweeter and more grain forward than I expected, very malty, low bitterness, really increases drinkability. Palate is light bodied with just a hint of carbonation. Really tasty.
Bamberg jolly day 2 25/01/2014. Bottle in Ronnys room i think. Clouded yellow pour. Aroma is lemoney / spicy hop. Flavour is earthy, grass, bread, nutty malt. Slightly spicy hop in the finish.

17/03/2014 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Bevuta al FrankenFest, servita in boccale di coccio. Al naso delicati sentori di malto, pane, lieviti, leggere note luppolate erbacee. In bocca ha un attacco maltato, di pane al latte, il finale è bilanciato con un discreto amaro. Corpo leggero, carbonazione media. Una gran bella birra, si beve che è un piacere!
Pours in pale orange color with high head. Aroma is grainy, malty with noble hops. Taste is malty sweet, very light, medium noble bitterness. Full body with high carbonation. High drinkability.

How: Bottle.
Where: During the Bamber Jolly 2014.
Appearance: Hazy yellow colour with a white head.
Aroma: Hops, bread, malt, fruit.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, yeast, bread.

(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno)) Served in Stein. 
Yeasty aroma. Cloudy orange color. Huge white head. Medium sweet, medium bitter, malty and hoppy flavor. Medium body. Long, very bitter finish.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht trübes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, grasig, getreidig. Geschmack leicht herb, getreidig, minimal würzig.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 Flasche aus dem Landbierparadies-Laden, Nürnberg. - Orangegelb, trüb. Nase angenehm honigmalzig, mit grasigem Hopfen. Antrunk fruchtig-herb, leichte Aprikose. In der Mitte frisch und saftig mit kernig-gerstigem Malz von zarter Honigsüße, das wunderbar mit der fruchtig-harzigen Hopfenbittere kontrastiert. Niedrig gespundet, was für mich immer ein Pluspunkt ist. Im Abgang harzige Hopfenbittere; längerer Nachtrunk mit etwas schroffer Bittere. - Enorm süffig und rund und aromatisch und gut gehopft - ein richtig gutes Kellerbier!

Draught at Zly Casy, Prague. Clear golden beer with a nice white head. Malty bready aroma, grassy notes, spicy, some floral notes. Hoppy grassy flavor, citrus, grapes, bready, spicy notes. Fresh and drinkable.
What a weird brew. Seems that the brewery brewed a rauchbier before this batch as this beer has a lot of smoke character in the flavor. So smoked kellerbier, something I havent tasted before. :-)

Bottle looks good. But with the yellow cap I first thought it was a radler. Beer in the glass zippy, nice head. Starts mild, quite moldy, a bit grasy-moldy, not too sourish. Fruity hints of plum. Some caramel notes. Finish less moldy, still dominated by malty notes. Not bad!

On tap at Zly Casy, Prague. Pours hazy straw coloured with a big creamy white head. Aroma of fresh spicy hops, grainy malts. Taste is smooth, perfect session beer, with grassy hops to cater for the good malty body. Lingering dry and hoppy finish, a gem of a beer.

Hellorange, verhaltene Schaumbildung. Hefig-getreidige Nase mit Citrusanklängen. Bamberg läßt sich nicht verleugnen. Rauchig-hopfiger Geschmack mit getreidigen Noten. Extrem süffiges Kellerbier, wenn auch sehr ungewöhnlich. Bamberg rulezzz

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2015 On tap at the brewery in Giesfeld.  Slightly herby hop, it?s great, no off flavours, no puke, just amazingly characterful flavourful tasty.  It?s good. Depth then hop builds. 3.7 at Keller lager malt aroma lightly carbonated. Hops on the finish are good. I wouldnt disagree with my previous rating. It builds.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 Draft at Griess.
Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy light to medium yellow.
Aroma is lightly malty (cracker, grain), lightly hoppy (herbs), lightly to moderately yeasty (dough), with a note of lemon pith.
Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.
Good quaffing, but not the most expressive or interesting nose.

500ml bottle (HBF2013, Saturday) - not sure if this is the right beer, my notes say Zoikelbier de Greiss Keller
Lovely soft grainy aroma. Dry crisp body, loads of light grains. Very well attenuated. Gentle hops in the finish, a touch woody. Nice, full of life and uplifting.
On tap, Zly Casy, Prague, 2012. 11. 01. Béla szerint selymes, lágy, szerintem kicsit karcos.
Keg at Zly Casy. Hazy Golden with a white head. Lots of bitterness and a bit of sherbet flavour made this an interesting beer which I really enjoyed.

Draught at Gallows Bird, Espoo. Poured pale copper in color with a very thin bubbly white head. Sweet butterscotch and velvet candy in aroma. Flavour is mostly butterscotch, some more sweet brown sugar and hints of very light hoppyness. Smooth and feels like velvet while drinking. Very enjoyable. Light hoppy finish. Nice one.
Bottle poured into a ceramic mug. I must have had an off bottle. Weird sweetness, some floral notes, and off grainy notes.
Blonde body with a small white head. Aroma is freshmade bread, citrus. Taste is citrus again, slightly hoppy. Dry finish
Yellow colour, very clear for a keller. Sweet with a slightly bitter finish, notes of dough, banana and pepper. Very drinkable.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 26 April 2012) Pale golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty, hoppy nose with bread, grass and tropical fruit. Malty, hoppy taste with notes of grass, bread, tropical fruit, toffee, chewy malt and a generous grassy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a certain malt sweetness. Very fresh and very tasty. Excellent kellerbier.

0,5 l bottle.   Best before 14.07,2012
bread, hay, cereal, nuts, floral, citrus, herbs, barnyard, earthy, leaves, licorice, golden, hazy, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, salty, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,
Draught @ Akkurat. Very hoppy kellerbier. Notes of gooseberries, lime - and with a refreshing bitterness. A bit one dimensional, otherwise good.

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and its not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog!

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel goldgelbes Bier mit leichter Trübung. Die Krone ist fein, flach und langlebig. Das Kellerbier duftet hefig und fruchtig zitronig, sehr spritzig. Der Antrunk erfolgt dann sehr herb würzig, zitrus-fruchtig und spritzig frisch. Die Säure legt sich zur Mitte etwas, man spürt mehr Hefe und es wird ein wenig fruchtiger, sprich süßer. Der Abgang ist ebenfalls angenehm zitrus-fruchtig, sehr frisch und spritzig insgesamt, dieses Kellerbier

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2014 Numerous gravity pours at the brewpub and keller are markedly improved from my first few bottle samples years ago. Hopcentric and lemony with Spalt, yeasty, rustic, nice pils malt, good balance, pretty clean. Could use a touch more refinement, but all in all this is very lovely.  Bottle, Purchased at Landbierparadies in Nurnberg, Best Before 3/15/12, consumed in early November: Light chestnut. Fragmented ivory foam.   Dirty nose of wort and grape and lesser notes of spicy licorice-tinged hops and an earthy dry maltiness. Obviously underattenuated. Soft carbonation. Opens with sharp earthy malts atop an overbearing base of residual sugar. Some graininess is apparent right from the start, which gradually heightens in intensity. Deeply earthy notes of sassafras, burnt wood and licorice root lend an unpleasant bitterness that clashes with the cleaner elements while virtually leeching every trace of saliva from the palate. Finishes with a caustic rubbery astringency and everlasting flavors of wort. Something is evidently awry here because this is severely underattenuated and sloppy. (5, 3, 5,3, 9 = 2.5)
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text:
In short: A medium-hoppy blonde lager with a pleasant countryside/farmhouse character.  Lovely
How: Many fresh 500ml bottles bought in Germany a week before, German-theme tasting
The look: Cloudy blonde body topped by a small white head
In long: Another lager with a rustic character, not quite like the farmhouse of the Wagner-Bräu we drank just before, this one emanates a sensation of countryside field, wild flowers and fresh hay.  Taste of fresh hay, straws, grassy hops, a light spiciness, a mild fruity tartness.  When fresh (this was fresh) this is one to drink by the gallon.  Another underrated session lager.  I could complain that session lagers always get low ratings on this website, but in my book the people who only love big beers have the right to express their opinions on this website.  My book is entitled People with no taste in beer are allowed to use ratebeer

3 bouteilles de 500 ml partagées lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Odeur de céréales avec une pointe dhoublons herbacés. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales et dhoublons herbacés. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de céréales en arrière goût. (Rating #3899)

(33cl bottle dated 6-12 thanks to blutt59) clear pale yellow with lasting fine white bubbles. Nose of grain, butter, and sweet cream. Taste of butter, a bit of garbage, raw grain, herbal and earthy. Well carbonated, very earthy linger, reminds me of a lager.

Draught at the brewpub.
Thinn lace and a yellow color.
This beer is all aboute malt. Malty aroma and taste. Short and small bitterness. This really shows how good malts can bee.

Bottle courtesy blutt59. Pours a light yellow color that is almost slightly hazy. Light bubbles. Aroma is dry grains, bread, some salty notes and butter. Flavor is very dry and bitter. Grains and more grains. Some buttery notes but very faint.

Thanks to blutt59 for sharing this bottle. We can always count on Bob to share the rare German beers. 

The beer pours a yellow color with a white head. The aroma is heavy on the wheat with some grass from the hops mixed in. The flavor is heavy on the wheat with some lemon notes. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
(500ml bottle)  Pours a clear yellow body with a small white head.  Aroma of toasted grain, honey, nuts, and mustiness.  Flavor of grass, grain, sulfur, and straw with a dry, bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2016 Tap from wood @ Brewery  , Geisfeld. Ceramic mug. Unclear golden with a frothy white head and lacings. Spicy hoppy nose and flavor. Grass, grain, wood and breadcrust. Smooth with a medium to low carbonation. Really dry, bitter and hoppy finish! Crisp. Lovely! Numerous bottles and tap pours over the years. Lemon citrus twang to the hops. Amazing. 3,7-4,3
bottled, thanks to erlangernick in trade, clear yellow in color with some sweet watery fruit and light finish
Aromatisch karameliger Antrunk mit deutlicher dominanter Hopfennote. Dies weitet sich aus, das Bier wird dadruch aber nicht aromatischer. Süßlich getreidig. 8/9/10/10//9

Bottle February in Franconia (2011) Hazy, light golden lager with a small, creamy, white head that never dissipates - not a smidge. The musky, malty nose is a blend of peppery, earthy hops, pale grains and honey. Medium-bodied with a mildly creamy mouthfeel and modest carbonation. The flavor is bittersweet and spicy  acute, peppery bitterness grips tight as the sweet malts fade. Zippy, bitter finish. Thanks go out to erlangernick and Koelschtrinker for making this month of Franconian lagers possible!

bottle from Landbierparadies. Hazy pale yellow colour, extremely persistent white head, with a quite rocky appearance. Hoppy nose. Malty background with lots of resiny-grassy hopy and a lovely dry bitterness. Delicious!

botlle, 39 CZK, very nice keller aroma, fully herb and hop,golden, hazy, white foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, full body, slick feel, long finish, bitter, average carbonation, very good beer
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text:
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2011 500ml bottle shared by MartinT
Appearance : Slightly hazy yellow with white foamy head. Awesome head retention.

Aroma : Great citrusy hops with herbal notes. Nice malt. Some hay and light notes of humid grain. Nice citrusy/fruity notes. A bit earthy.

Taste : Great chewy malts with lots of herbal hops. Citrusy notes too. Finish is rather bitter (especially for the style). Light spicy notes, light pine. Carbonation is delightfully soft.

Overall : Wow. Very nice beer. I dont really know why I rated it so averagely last time... Very tasty and very complex. Nice farmhouse character with the wet grain notes. Quite bitter for the style but quite interesting... I think I would have enjoyed slightly less bitterness. Very well balanced. Awesome malt profile. Great drink ability and quite refreshing. Stunning !

On tap at Abseit.
Aroma : Herbal and malty.  A little bit of honey. Lots of malt.

Taste : A bit salty with nice herbal hops. A little bit citrusy also. Some notes of algaes...

Overall : Interesting. Quite good but not the best kellerbier I had. The Wilde Rose was better. Aug 2nd 2010. 7,3,7,3,15;3.5

Bottle, kindly shared by Jan & Charlotte. Its looking quite appropriate in the glass, with its hazy golden-orange body under a finger-thick white to off-white head. Slightly yeasty nose, with pale malts and hops doing most of the aroma work. There seems to be some smoke in it too. That smoke can be found in the mouth too, supporting pale malts and a nice bitterness. Dry and full-bodied, with a bitter finish. A pleasant one. 090821

Bottle 50cl.Clear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, toasted, smoke notes, light yeasty, sulfur. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20090821]

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Hazy yellow with floating impurities and a small, off-white head. Malt and flowery hops. Medium body, dry maltiness and a distinct smoky note. Solid dose of bitterness in the finish. 210809
Its a hazy, warm golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt and light smoke. The flavor has sweetness and notes of light smoke, malt, fruit and a touch of citrus in the finish.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2013 Cloudy golden with a medium white head. Hoppy aroma with malty and grassy notes. Flavour had grassy hops, malt and straw. Finished dry and bitter.

8/21/2009 8:46:00 PM
Hazy amber with a medium white head. Sweet aroma with hints of smoke, malt and caramel notes. Smoked flavour with malt, caramel and grassy hops. Finished bitter.
6,3,6,3,14
Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a thin beige head. Tthe aroma is sweet with notes of malt and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of sulphur, straw, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.
50 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Sweet malty, light yeasty and mild suplhorish. Dry bitter, sulphorish and dry malty flavoured. Bitter and dry bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2010 Cask at the brewerys Keller. Looks hazy golden in the mug. Small white head. Good malty flavour, nicely yeasty. Mild and refreshing. 7 3 7 3 15

Draught at the brewerys Keller. White head. The colour looks golden in the mug. The flavour starts off with a rough hoppiness. Mild grassy hop flavour. Clean. 7 3 7 3 15

GETESTET AM 18. Juni  IM KAFFEE ABSEITS IN BAMBERG ORIGINAL VOM FASS:
NATURRÜBES JEDOCH TROTZDEM KLARES kELLERBIER IM ANTRUNK FRUCHTIGES AROMA IM ABGANG HERB ERFRISCHEND:VERFÜPHRT ZUM MEHRDRINKEN:!!!

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2009 Hazy light gold.  Toasty, hoppy nose.  Very toasty, woody character...this is almost smokey.  Long bitterness goes right into the finish.  An interesting, unique example of Frankenlager. 7-4-7-4-16 = 3.8vom holz @ Griess KellerLots of wood and earthy hops on the nose.  Some nice subtle malt notes.  Big wood notes on the palate.  Earthy with dried flowers and herbs, cocoa.  A unique gamut of flavours.  Crisp ,firm body with a healthy dose of malts.  Finishes dry and earthy with advanced wood notes.  This woody version is one of the most complex, fully realized beers Ive had in a long time.  Wood fans rejoice!

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ From Stein. Aroma is hops, earth, some bready maltyness. Flavour is quite much the same along with big yeasty, bready and earthy notes in the finish. Pleasant balance and refreshing. Fits pasta well.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2009 Draft @ Abseits. Nice hazy yellow gold with giant lasting head. Well-hopped aroma. Light watery palate is quaffable like a cask ale. Earthy and balanced beer with great bitterness. Rustic and refined at the same time. 7-4-7-4-15  From gravity barrel. Thick beige head. Frankenbier aroma is mild, woody, farmy. Quaffable palate. Flavors are unique. Wood resin. Floral and perfume without soap. Juicy hops. Stones, minerals, fruit, and funk. Tastes like dandelion tea steeped in a wooden cup. 
Highly characterful beer deserving of further study :) 8-4-8-5-16

(Bottle at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2009-04-24) Golden and lightly hazy. Medium sized, white and long lasting head. Grass, some boiled vegetables and barn in aroma. Medium bodied and dry palate with medium carbonation. Malts, fruitiness, flour, bitterness, malts and lighlty butter in taste. Bitter and malty aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2009 (bottle) pours a hazy golden colour with a short-lived frothy white head. aroma of grainy pale malts, herbal hops and some light oak. flavour is the same, with an emphasis on fresh grain and a surprisingly strong smokiness. medium body and carbonation with a bitter herbal hoppy finish.

(6/31/08) Bottle at Cafe’ Abseits in Bamberg. Served in a ceramic mug, but from what I can see it’s slightly dark golden with a big off-white head. Aroma has malt, caramel, some hops and hints of citrus. Sweetish malty flavor with some caramel at first. Continues drier with some citrus, and nice hoppiness with a bit of grass in the finish. Medium-bodied with a rounded mouthfeel.

Bottle. Café Abseits, Bamberg. 
Golden colour, with steady frothy head. Bit fruity aroma and dewy malty. Good malty flavour with soft mouthfeel and little caramelly and dusty. A very clean beer that ends on a dry note.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2014 From wooden gravity keg at the brewery in Giesfeld (June 2008).   hazy  body with a patchy off-white head.  Nose of old fruit and nuts, some grassy hops.  Wet grain / bread, hay, wheat, etc.  Toasty and soft.


re-rate May 2013: quite nice, very floral, lemony, flowery and fresh.  smooth malt texture, creamy low carbonation.  definitely in good shape, a surprise to find again.

again in November 2013: Nectary, lemony, doughy, juicy, some Vitamin b and sulfur. less hoppy than before.  still solid.

Bottle at Cafe Abseits, Bamberg 5/11/07. Delicate gold colour with a fine, frothy head. Light summer fruit aroma, with floral hops and some biscuity malt. Flavour was finely balanced between fruity malt, grassy/floral hops and a dry, peppery finish. This excellent beer also had a great spritzy mouthfeel.

At the brewpub, served in a mug but as far as I could see it was cloudy golden with a white head. Sweet, heavily hopped aroma gives lots of pine, citrus, fruit and slightly sweet malt. Bitter flavours, also hop dominated in a good way... balanced but assertive is another way to put it. Hoppy, lingering finish. It hurts to rate this as I sit back in Australia... how I miss Franconia.
Bottle@Café Abseits, Bamberg. Really good kellerbier. Crisp and grassy, with some dried apricot fruityness and lightly bready malt notes. Finish is dry and bitter. This was really rather good!

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2007 on tap at cafe abseits in bamberg watching argentina hammer serbia. nice golden colour with a steady head. quite a tropical aroma - pineapple and menthol. some strawberry jam sweetness and a prickly minty finish. classy stuff

Draught, Cafe Abseits, Bamberg. Golden color with fine head. Deliscious flowery, fruity and grassy/herbal aroma - complex. Fruity sweet and well rounded flavor, finishes dry. This was one of the 3 best beers I had during my stay in Bamberg. The others were Keesman Herren pils and Schlenkerla Rauchbier - served from the lagering tanks by Matthias Trum in the brewery cellar.

Draught at Café Abseits.  Seidla from the ceramic, branded Krug.  Strong cellary aoma with a little chalk and a little funk.  Taste is very cellary, strong funky hoppiness, bittersweet.  Dry, chalky, and lasting.  Looks to be gold/amber when I part the creamy white head.  Body is medium-full, smooth, earthy.  One of the best beers Ive had in Bamberg.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2017 Impressions from different bottles and taps:
-Herbal, earthy and grassy hop perfumes are showcased, all coalescing in a friendly, never overpowering manner.
-There is plenty of sticky foam to cover the very pale blond.
-A complex continuum of citrusy, floral, peppery, and grassy hop petals form a botanical garden the likes of which Id like to revisit more often.
-A touch of sulfur adds to the complexity, being quite harmonious with the hay-like malts and herbal hops. 
-The ample effervescence manages to remain cushiony and comfortable.
-The lightly honeyed malts are well dried out, adding a rustic, hay-like touch.
-The finish is full of peppery, earthy hop bitterness, leaving a poignant aftertaste.
-Simply put, this is an absolutely marvelous session beer for hopheads imbued with an unmistakable rustic personality.

Bottles and on tap from Blaue Glocke and Griess Brauerei.
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2005 (Bottle, 0,5 Litres ) Dense and green colour, slight head, typical Kellerbier-Aroma with that cold mossylike hints, quite sourly and sadly not well-balanced --- 25.03.04

Bottled
Pale yellow, good creamy white head, lace. Malty, lemony hoppy aroma - very kellerbier-like. Medium-bodied with tasty malt profile. Vey nice Saaz-hoppy flavor. Long hoppy, a bit grassy aftertaste. Excellent example of this style.

(bottle) Hazy yellow colour with a big and stable white foam. Herbal hoppy and yeasty aroma with a touch of wet straw. Smooth and rounded taste of initial soft sweet maltiniess and a rising very aromatic bitter hoppiness, especially in the dry and lasting finish. One of the best Kellerbeers I had so far.

(Bottled) Slightly hazy golden color with a smallish head. Earthy toffee-muddy salty and smoky aroma. Very buttery, malty dandelion flavor with smoky hints and some acidity. Medium-bodied, slightly sweet, earthy palate with balanced carbonation. A very nice and earthy brew with pleasant smokiness.

Served in  Stein ; overflowing white head, wipped  egg-white like. Fruity nose, yeast effects, herbal. Dry-hoppy taste, fruity, near citrussy hops., over a discreet but good layer of cookie malts. Light to medium bodied. Dryness makes it seem lighter. Great Kellerbier, stamped by the yeast. Even bottled, it breaths freshness, the way simple beer ought to be. And become complex in its own way.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2007 On tap at the brewery: Amber coloured, thin, lasting head; floral hoppy nose, moderate bitter flavour, moderate fruity-bitter taste; long lasting dry and very aromatic hoppy finish; well rounded, smooth. One of the best in good old Franconia.....! Re-rated June 2007: On tap in the beer-garden: Yeasty, worty and strong bitter floral-hoppy nose; strong, dryish bitter flavour, soft MF, light bodied; long lasting dry floral-aromatic finish with a touch of pale-malt. A gorgeous Kellerbier...............

Hazy orange color, fizzy carbonation and also fizzy medium white head. Citrus, slightly skunky hay and drainpipe nose. Intense grass, chalk and dust taste, long lasting with a very intense sage finish.

Slight drainpipe nose, grainy and citrus, also like an herbal tea mix. Hazy pale khaki color with a low sticky scumy head. Quick sweet apple malt immediately gives ay to a very bitter hop flavor. Stings like an unripe grapefruit. Grassy, like rocket or a dandelion. Thin body so the hops really come through. One dimensional - all hop bitter - but kinda fun. Like an IPA. Probably the hoppiest German beer Ive ever had.

Bottle, at Café Abseits in Bamberg. Jan 2005. Hazy gold, fluffy white head and gentle condition. Sweet yeast and peppery hop dominated aromas, softly yeasty in the mouth with some solid hoppiness and a background nutty malt note. Lingering hop bitter finish with a hint of hazelnuts at the end.

Bottled. Cloudy yellow. Aroma of fresh barley and herbal spices. These aromatic flavours lingers from nose to finish, where also a hefty dose of hops sets in, creating a massively bitter finish. The mouthfeel is soft, and the body is light. A world class kellerbier, if you can tolerate all the bitterness.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2005 Blonde and cloudy. Slight lemon aroma, somewhat flowery. Fine hopbitter flavor with a hint of lemon and a hint of glue. Hopbitter aftertaste. Well made and tasty kellerbier, lightyears away from more industrial brews.
Pale color, slightly cloudy. Fresh cheese aroma. Hoppy flavor with fresh cheese and citrus. Hoppy, oily aftertaste. there is a lot of character and even some brett character in this kellerbier.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2006 Citric yeast aroma and fine aromahops.
Orange/yellow with yeast in suspension and a big white frothy head.
Medium body, sweet malt and wild honey, fantastic hop balance dominated by aromahops, dry herbal finish with a added yeasty earthnotes. Sparkly dry mouthfeel.
